page.title: 11The Janet Street Fair
page.content: This fair introduced in 1975 is held in Janet Street because it is the widest street suitable for stalls and people.Organised by the Round Table it raises money for charity which was Â£6000 last year.It takes 3 weeks to arrange nearly 50 stalls which attract about 5000 people.It is held on a Saturday at 18.30 because it is the most convenient time for everyone. Round Table members set up stalls for raffles,garden produce,cake and candy. The most popular are the teddy bear and bottle stalls.Decorations are chosen by the members and it costs Â£250 to run the fair.Prizes to be won are watches,teddies and sweets.The most unusual raffle prize was a live lamb.Hungry customers can buy hot dogs,barbequed food and ice cream.The funniest stalls were for custard pie throwing and pouring water over people
